perturbation.original_text: 1.1 Net Investment Income. "Fund Investment Income", as defined in paragraph 1.2 below, minus "Fund Operating Expenses" as defined  in paragraph 1.3 below equals Net Investment Income. If the Fund's Net Investment Income on any day is below zero, the Investment  Adviser shall waive its Advisory Fee or reimburse the Fund an amount (defined as "Expense Waiver") sufficient to produce a Net  Investment Income of zero.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1 Net Investment Income. "Fund Investment Income", as defined in paragraph 1.2 below, minus "Fund Operating Expenses" as defined  in paragraph 1.3 below equals Net Investment Income. If the Fund's Net Investment Income on any day is below zero, the Investment  Adviser may consider waiving its Advisory Fee or partially reimburse the Fund an amount (defined as "Expense Waiver") sufficient to possibly produce a Net  Investment Income nearing zero.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that the Investment Adviser *shall* waive its fee or reimburse the Fund. The modified text replaces 'shall' with 'may consider' and replaces 'sufficient to produce a Net Investment Income of zero' with 'sufficient to possibly produce a Net Investment Income nearing zero' making the obligation discretionary and the target outcome uncertain. This introduces ambiguity regarding the Investment Advisor's responsibility.

perturbation.original_text: 1.5 Right of Recovery. The Investment Adviser shall have the option to recover the full amount waived, paid or reimbursed (the Expense  Waiver) by the Investment Adviser on any day on which the Fund's Net Investment Income exceeds zero. In no event, however, shall  the Expense Waiver, or any portion thereof, constitute an obligation of the Fund to the Investment Adviser on any such day unless  the Investment Adviser has expressly exercised its right to recover all or a portion of the Expense Waiver on that day, in which case  such portion of the Expense Waiver elected by the Investment Adviser for recovery that day shall then be due and payable. If, and to  the extent, the payment by the Fund to the Investment Adviser of the Expense Waiver would cause the Fund's Net Investment Income  to fall below zero, such payment shall be deferred until such date on which the
perturbation.changed_text: 1.5 Right of Recovery. The Investment Adviser *may* have the option to recover *a portion* of the amount waived, paid or reimbursed (the Expense  Waiver) by the Investment Adviser on any day on which the Fund's Net Investment Income exceeds *a pre-determined threshold, subject to trustee approval*. In no event, however, shall  the Expense Waiver, or any portion thereof, constitute an obligation of the Fund to the Investment Adviser on any such day *until* the Investment Adviser has expressly exercised its right to recover all or a portion of the Expense Waiver on that day, in which case  such portion of the Expense Waiver elected by the Investment Adviser for recovery that day shall then be due and payable *if mutually agreed upon by all parties*. If, and to  the extent, the payment by the Fund to the Investment Adviser of the Expense Waiver would cause the Fund's Net Investment Income  to fall below zero, such payment *might* be deferred until such date on which the
perturbation.explanation: The original text grants the Investment Adviser the option to recover the 'full amount' of the expense waiver. The modified version changes this to 'may have the option to recover *a portion*' and adds the vague concept of a 'pre-determined threshold, subject to trustee approval' and 'if mutually agreed upon by all parties', and changes 'shall' to 'might' again making the action uncertain. This creates a contradiction because it is unclear whether the Investment Advisor is entitled to full recovery, and introduces new conditions for recovery that were not previously present.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement will terminate upon the termination of the Advisory Agreement except the Investment Adviser's Right of  Recovery set forth in section 1.5 herein.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement may terminate upon the *potential* termination of the Advisory Agreement *pending further review* except the Investment Adviser's *potential* Right of  Recovery set forth in section 1.5 herein *which is now subject to review by the board of trustees.*
perturbation.explanation: The original agreement clearly states that termination of the Advisory Agreement will automatically terminate this agreement, with a specific exception. The modified version introduces ambiguity by stating the agreement 'may terminate' and adding 'potential' and 'pending further review', along with subjecting section 1.5 to further review, casting doubt on the termination clause's certainty, and creating uncertainty on if termination is automatic or requires more action. The section on the Investment Advisor's rights is also affected, creating a conflict.
